DOC.detailed_description: Community Health Workers ( CHWs ) potential improve chronic disease outcomes among patient low socioeconomic status ( SES ) . Yet , widespread use CHWs hamper lack standardized , scalable evidence-based model . Our community-academic-health system team use participatory action research low-SES patient design IMPaCT ( Individualized Management Patient-Centered Targets ) . A randomized control trial ( RCT ) 446 hospitalized patient varied disease demonstrate 2-week dose IMPaCT improve access care , mental health , activation , quality communication , reduce recurrent hospital readmission . We adapt IMPaCT use among low-SES primary care patient multiple chronic condition . This RCT design evaluate newly adapt IMPaCT model 3 primary care setting - academic , federally qualified health center , VA . Upon enrollment trial , patient collaboratively set chronic disease management goal primary care provider . Patients randomized collaborative goal-setting versus goal-setting augment 6 month support IMPaCT CHW . Follow-up conduct 6- 9- month post-enrollment . The study design single-blinded , 2- arm , multi-site randomize controlled trial involve three clinic site 444 patient .
